wikitext.*:
'''Sidney Barrowclough''' ([[1894]] - [[1 February]] [[1969]]) was a member of the [[T.C.B.S.]]. A few years younger than the core members, Barrowclough (and [[Ralph Payton]]) continued the T.C.B.S. after the "big four"<ref group=note>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Geoffrey Bache Smith]], [[Christopher Wiseman]], and [[Robert Gilson]]</ref> left King Edward's School.

Barrowclough was born in 1894 to John and Emily Barrowclough. He had a younger sister Agnes, born in [[1889]].<ref name=lives/> In October of either [[1911]] or [[1913]],<ref group=note>[[John Garth|Garth]] provides both conflicting dates.</ref> Barrowclough, along with Ralph Payton, joined the T.C.B.S.<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'', "Before"</ref> While at [[King Edward's School]], he played as [[Wikipedia:Three-quarter back|three-quarter back]] on the school rugby team.<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'', "prologue"</ref> Barrowclough is described by [[John Garth]] as "[affecting] a cold cynicism, robing his sarcasm in verbal elegance".<ref>[[John Garth]], ''[[Tolkien and the Great War]]'', "The Council of London"</ref> Barrowclough would serve in the [[Wikipedia:Royal Field Artillery|Royal Field Artillery]] at the rank of [[Wikipedia:Second Lieutenant#United Kingdom and other Commonwealth countries|Second Lieutenant]] during [[World War I]]. Barrowclough married Constance Marian Page in [[1920]] and died on [[1 February]], 1969.<ref name=lives>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://livesofthefirstworldwar.iwm.org.uk/lifestory/220282|articlename=We Remember Sidney Barrowclough|dated=|website=[https://livesofthefirstworldwar.iwm.org.uk/lifestory/220282 Lives of the First World War]|accessed=21 April 2024}}</ref>
